result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ira L Nettles was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $3200.00 fine plus costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No bars, taverns, or liquor stores.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ira L Nettles

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM Defendant Ira L Nettles in court, in custody.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Ira L Nettles.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Uzowulu has gone over charge with defendant and waives reading of charging document provided in Court.
Defendant is waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.
Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his rights.
Attorney Uzowulu believes waiver to be made freely, knowingly, and voluntarily.  Court so finds.
Parties have reached an agreement to resolve this case and agreement is read into the record.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1.
Court has a colloquy with defendant.
Defendant acknowledges three prior offenses.
Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29 and ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored.
Attorney Uzowulu believes plea to be made freely, knowingly, and voluntarily.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty of count 1 and will dismiss and read-in count 2.
Court adopts agreement and imposes:

Four (4) years in the Wisconsin State Prison System, bifurcated as one (1) year Initial Confinement followed by three (3) years Extended Supervision, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant is entitled to one hundred twenty-six (126) days dead time credit to be applied first to 21CT69.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Pay $3200 fine plus costs, including supervision fees.  
No alcohol.
No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No bars, taverns, or liquor stores.
No weapons.
Lifetime revocation of drivers license.
Thirty-six (36) month IID requirement.
Pay restitution, if any.
Complete AODA and follow-through with any recommendations.
Complete any other counseling as recommended by agent.
Complete assessment and rehabilitation.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
